meanings.definition: The distribution of religious literature by itinerant vendors.
meanings.sent1: The colportages brought religious books to different towns.
meanings.sent2: She supported herself through colportages of religious literature.
meanings.sent3: The colportages decided to have a race to see who could distribute the most books.
meanings.sent4: His colportages of knowledge reached even the most remote areas.
meanings.sent5: The colportages' bags were filled with books of all sizes and shapes.

meanings.definition: The act of selling or distributing books or pamphlets door-to-door.
meanings.sent1: Every Saturday, she would go out for colportages in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The colportages were well-received by the community.
meanings.sent3: The colportages knocked on the wrong door and ended up selling a book about cats to a dog lover.
meanings.sent4: His colportages were so persuasive that even the most reluctant customers ended up buying something.
meanings.sent5: The colportages' cheerful demeanor made people more willing to listen to their offers.

meanings.definition: The trade or business of selling books or religious literature.
meanings.sent1: She decided to pursue a career in colportages after realizing her passion for books.
meanings.sent2: The colportages in the market were known for their friendly approach.
meanings.sent3: The colportages' competition was fierce, but they always found a way to stand out.
meanings.sent4: In the world of colportages, reputation is everything.
meanings.sent5: His success in colportages allowed him to open his own bookstore.
